Posted By: Kidromeo (6/9/2011 9:18:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@mflanaga & tcollins:  
You're both correct, but for different reasons. As tcollins said, he would be able to declare BS as a blocker, then tap a creature (as long as it's not already attacking or tapped) before combat damage would be dealt to destroy BS. Trying to tap an attacking creature (as it seems you were understanding it, mflanaga) would not prevent any damage, and would in fact do nothing.
posts.html:
@mflanaga & tcollins:
You're both correct, but for different reasons. As tcollins said, he would be able to declare BS as a blocker, then tap a creature (as long as it's not already attacking or tapped) before combat damage would be dealt to destroy BS. Trying to tap an attacking creature (as it seems you were understanding it, mflanaga) would not prevent any damage, and would in fact do nothing.
